AIRTIME.Defintion: (the amount of) broadcasting time that someone or something has on television or radio

AN INSIDE JOB.Defintion: a crime, especially stealing, committed by someone in the organisation in which they work

ASSUME.Defintion: to accept something to be true without question or proof

ATTRIBUTE.Defintion: a quality or characteristic that someone or something has

BADDIES.Defintion: people, especially in a film or story, who are bad

BLOCKS.Defintion: a solid, straight-sided piece of hard material

CHILD SEX RING.Defintion: a group relating to the abuse of children

CRYOGENICALLY.Defintion: ‚Äçif you are cryogenically frozen, you are frozen after death, with a view to being brought back to life

DEBUNKED.Defintion: proved to be false or incorrect

DEEP STATE.Defintion: organizations such as military, police, or political groups that are said to work secretly in order to protect particular interests and to rule a country without being elected

DISTRACT.Defintion: to make someone stop giving their attention to something

EASE.Defintion: the state of experiencing no difficulty, effort, pain, etc

FAKED.Defintion: not real, but made to look or seem real

FANNING THE FLAMES.Defintion: to make a dangerous or unpleasant mood or situation worse

FRANCHISE.Defintion: a series of films that have the same or similar titles and are about the same characters

GIVEN THE LIGHT OF DAY.Defintion: when something sees the light of day, it appears for the first time

GOODIES.Defintion: people, especially in a film or story, who are good

INSTITUTION.Defintion: a large and important organization, such as a university or bank

INTENTIONALLY.Defintion: in a planned or intended way

LAUGHABLE.Defintion: silly and not deserving to be seriously considered

LEGITIMISES.Defintion: to make something legal or acceptable

MAINSTREAM.Defintion: considered normal, and having or using ideas, beliefs, etc. that are accepted by most people

NICHE.Defintion: interesting to, aimed at, or affecting only a small number of people

OVERPLAY.Defintion: to make something seem more important than it really is

PILED UP.Defintion: objects positioned one on top of another

PREHISTORIC.Defintion: describing the period before there were written records

QUITE A STRETCH.Defintion: if something is a stretch, usually means that it is not very believable or that something doesn't fit

RABBIT WARREN.Defintion: a series of connecting underground passages and holes in which rabbits live, used figuratively to describe the fact that one link would lead to another

SEDUCTIVE.Defintion: making you want to do, have, or believe something, because of seeming attractive

SERIAL.Defintion: used to describe a person who repeatedly commits a similar crime or carries out a similar bad act, or the crime or act itself

SLIPPERY SLOPE.Defintion: a bad situation or habit that, after it has started, is likely to get very much worse

SPREAD.Defintion: to move from one place to another, or to cause something to move or be communicated

SUPPOSEDLY.Defintion: used to show that you do not believe that something you have been told is true

SURFACED.Defintion: if a feeling or information surfaces, it becomes known

TAMED.Defintion: (especially of animals) not wild or dangerous, either naturally or because of training or long involvement with humans

TENUOUS.Defintion: a tenuous connection, idea, or situation is weak and possibly does not exist

WACKIEST.Defintion: most strange, unusual in a pleasing and exciting or silly way
